title: Vegan Spicy Jollof Rice
description: A spicy and flavorful West African rice dish, made vegan-friendly, perfect for a satisfying meal or a feast with friends.

steps.text: Rinse the long-grain rice under cold water until the water runs clear. Set aside.
Blend diced red and green bell peppers, half of the diced onion, canned tomatoes, and tomato paste in a blender until smooth. Set aside.
In a large pot, heat coconut oil over medium heat.
Add the remaining diced onion and saut√© until translucent.
Stir in minced garlic and grated ginger, cooking for another minute.
Pour the blended pepper and tomato mixture into the pot. Cook for about 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add rinsed rice to the pot, stirring to coat with the sauce.
Pour in the vegetable broth; add Scotch bonnet (if using), bay leaves, thyme, paprika, cayenne pepper, salt, and black pepper.
Cover the pot with a tight-fitting lid and reduce the heat to low. Simmer for 25-30 minutes or until the rice is tender, stirring occasionally to prevent sticking.
Once the rice is cooked and fluffy, adjust seasoning if necessary.
Remove bay leaves and Scotch bonnet before serving.
Fluff the jollof rice with a fork, and garnish with additional diced peppers if desired.
